Step 2: Evidence Slice 4 states that mountains are very heavy and cause the underlying crust to bend and sag like a trampoline, which lowers the peak, and further notes that the weight can overpower uplift, clearly describing downward bending of the crust under heavy mountains as a limiting factor. Logic holds because the proposed answer names these two processes—glacial carving and crustal sagging—as the mechanisms limiting mountain height, directly matching the text in the slices.
